omnitureOnPage.description:
The Omniture s_code config version of the plugin, allows you to connect the Omniture plugin to your existing s_code.js configuration for easy integration of video analytics into an Omniture site.
For full implementation guide see Omniture on page in the Knowledge Center

s_codeUrl.doc: The URL to the Ominture generated sCode file that must be set in the uiConf (not via flashvars). This parameter is required for the plugin to work.

s_codeVarName.doc: The name of s_code entry point in the global window scope. ( "s" by default ).
s_codeVarName.label: Entry code name

onPageJs1.doc: The link to the omnitureOnPage plugin script.
onPageJs1.label: Plugin script URL

monitorEventInterval.doc: Set to an interval ( in seconds ) for tracking the Omniture 'monitor' event.
monitorEventInterval.label: Monitor event tracking interval

trackEventMonitor.doc: A global callback function for logging Omniture events.
trackEventMonitor.label: Omniture events function name

concatMediaName.doc: A per partner key for special media name concatenation rules. By default this parameter should be left null.
concatMediaName.label: Media name concatenation rules

customEvents.doc: A comma separated list of Kaltura player events you want to track.
customEvents.label: Kaltura player events

additionalEvarsAndProps.doc: A comma separated list of Omniture evars and props, you wish to pass along with every media event.
additionalEvarsAndProps.label: Omniture variables and properties

additionalEvarsAndPropsValues.doc:
A comma separated list of Kaltura values, you want to pass along with every media event.
				Values will correspond to the evars and props comma separated map defined in additionalEvarsAndProps.
additionalEvarsAndPropsValues.label: Kaltura values

autoTrack.doc: Default true, Value passed to autoTrack Omniture media module property.

trackWhilePlaying.doc: Default true, Value passed to trackWhilePlaying Omniture media module property.

videoDetailsBlock.description: This plugin creates a block that includes a title, description paragraph and list of tags of the currently playing media entry. The block will be appended to the player's div or be added to a given target div (the contents of the target div will be replaced). The design of the block is determined by the CSS of the plugin. Check out the integrate options for various configurations such as overriding the block title, show transition and more.

showTransition.doc: Whether to show the details block with a transition. If null, block will appear without transition

showTransitionDuration.doc: milliseconds for the transition duration, default is 300ms

targetDiv.doc: The id of the target div on the page where the block should be loaded. If null, block will load relative to the player

blockRelativePosition.doc: The relative location of the block. Only used if targetDiv is null. By default its set to append after the player

customTitle.doc: Overrides the entry name with a custom title for the block. If null, will load the currently playing entry name

limeSurveyCuePointForms.description: This plugin loads LimeSurvey survey ifrmaes over video in cue-points. To create the survey cue-points, use the Survey Cue-Points Editor

tags.doc: The cue-points tag that identify the type of cue-points to read (defined by the cue-points editor)

backgroundHexColor.doc: Hex color value (in the form of: #ffffff) indicating the background color of the survey overlay

backgroundAlpha.doc: Float value (0 to 1) indicating the opacity level of the survey overlay

descriptionBox.description: Appends or updates a target; with the asset's title and description

boxHeight.doc: Height of the description box, null to fill per height of content

boxWidth.doc: Box width ( can be 100% of parent ), null to fill 100% width

boxTargetId.doc: The target on page div id, for the title / description box

boxLocation.doc: The relative location of title / description box ( only used if boxTargetId is null ) by default its after the player

descriptionLabel.doc: Description label, entry title if null.

chaptersEdit.description:
Provides a simple interface for editing chapter annotation data. You 
		must provide your credentials on the "integrate" tab and select an entry from your 
		account to edits it's chapter cuePoints.

ks.doc: The authentication ks, required until we have iframe auth system in place

editTargetId.doc: The target id for chapter editing interface

customDataFields.doc: List of custom data properties to be listed in editor

tags.doc:
Default: "chaptering", Providing a tag name will grab only annotations which have that tag. 
									This allows multiple types of cuePoints to be stored on the same entry (e.g. chapters in different languages)

editPropId.doc: The target id to edit chapter cuePoint properties

editTimelineId.doc: The timeline id to for clickable timeline widget for cuePoints

chaptersView.description: Display video chapter information. See chapter samples, for highlighted sample chapter configuration

containerId.doc: Default: null, The chapter container id, will override some layout settings and allow you to place the chapters in a target div.

tags.doc:
Default: "chaptering"ï¿½ Providing a tag name will grab only annotations which have that tag. 
									This allows multiple types of cuePoints to be stored on the same entry (e.g. chapters in different languages)

parentName.doc:
Default: "chaptering"ï¿½ Providing a parentName will force querying only annotations whose parent fits parentName. 
									This allows multiple types of cuePoints to be stored on the same entry (e.g. chapters, references, ads).

layout.doc: Will affect the layout of the chapters. This will only add CSS classes, the actual visual layout is performed via CSS

containerPosition.doc: Will affect the position of the chaptering UI in relation to the video. This will only affect the structure of UI HTML elements, and will leave actual layout to be performed via CSS)

overflow.doc: Defines what should happen in case list of chapters require more space than videos dimensions. Combined with theï¿½ layoutï¿½ and positionï¿½ parameters, this parameter will cause a prev/next UI to appear if overflow is set to false.

includeThumbnail.doc: If set to true, a thumbnail HTML element will be generated containing the video frame from the startTime of the chapter

thumbnailWidth.doc: The width of the clip thumbnails in pixels ( default 100 )

horizontalChapterBoxWidth.doc: The total width of the chapter box for horizontal layout, in pixels ( default 320 )

thumbnailRotator.doc: If set to true (and assuming that includeThumbnail=true), will enable a thumbnail-rotator experience, allowing the user to rollover i. a chapter thumbnail and experience a few (4,5) additional frames of the chapter (length of the chapter will be computed by delta between startTime of this chapter and the next, then divide it by X frames and generate the additional thumbnails for the rotator using the thumbnail URL API)

includeChapterNumberPattern.doc: If set to true, chapter number will prefix chapter. If set to string, will substitute chapter into pattern. i.e "Ch $1 -" will prefix chapter text with "Ch 1 -", "Ch 2 -" etc.

includeChapterStartTime.doc: If the chapter start time should be included left of the title

includeChapterDuration.doc: If the chapter duration should be included right of the title

pauseAfterChapter.doc: If set to true, video playback will pause on chapter complete

titleLimit.doc: Display limit for chapter titles, default 24 characters

descriptionLimit.doc: Display limit for chapter description, default 70 characters

chapterRenderer.doc:
If provided, the plugin will delegate rendering of the plugin to this method,

chapterRenderer : function( cuePoint, $chapterBox )
cuePoint The cuePoint object, includes customData object as a property
$chapterBox A jQuery object reference to current chapter box

chaptersRenderDone.doc:
Optional callback for once chapter rendering is done

chaptersRenderDone: function( $chapterContainer )
$chapterContainer jQuery container of chapters.
